description: Fungal disease causing olive-green to black spots on leaves and fruit. Caused by Venturia inaequalis.
prevention_tips:
1. Plant resistant varieties (Liberty, Enterprise)
2. Remove fallen leaves in autumn
3. Prune for airflow (18-24" between branches)
4. Apply 5-10cm mulch (not touching trunk)
5. Avoid overhead irrigation
treatment_methods:
1. Apply copper fungicide at green tip stage
2. Sulfur sprays every 7-10 days during wet periods
3. Remove severely infected fruit
4. Summer fungicides if wet weather continues
organic_options:
1. Baking soda spray (1 tbsp/gallon)
2. Neem oil
3. Bacillus subtilis
4. Compost tea foliar spray
chemical_options:
1. Myclobutanil (Spectracide Immunox)
2. Trifloxystrobin + Fluopyram
3. Mancozeb (early season)

description: Fungal disease causing "frog-eye" leaf spots and mummified fruit. Caused by Botryosphaeria obtusa.
prevention_tips:
1. Remove all mummified fruit
2. Prune out dead wood
3. Disinfect tools between cuts
4. Avoid wounding trees
5. Maintain balanced fertilization
treatment_methods:
1. Apply fungicides during wet periods
2. Remove infected branches
3. Thin fruit clusters
4. Summer fungicide applications
organic_options:
1. Copper fungicides
2. Garlic extract sprays
3. Milk spray (1:9 ratio)

description: Fungal disease with orange leaf spots and gelatinous growths. Requires juniper as alternate host.
prevention_tips:
1. Remove nearby junipers (within 2 miles ideal)
2. Plant resistant varieties
3. Rake fallen leaves
4. Improve air circulation
treatment_methods:
1. Fungicide applications at pink bud stage
2. Repeat at 10-14 day intervals
3. Remove severely infected leaves
organic_options:
1. Sulfur sprays
2. Potassium bicarbonate
3. Garlic oil extract

description: Maintaining apple tree health to prevent disease
prevention_tips:
1. Annual pruning during dormancy
2. Balanced 10-10-10 fertilizer in spring
3. Consistent deep watering
4. Soil pH 6.0-6.5
5. 6-8 hours sunlight daily
treatment_methods:
1. Dormant oil spray in late winter
2. Regular monitoring for pests
3. Mulch renewal annually
organic_options:
1. Compost application in spring
2. Beneficial insect habitats
3. Organic foliar feeds
chemical_options:
1. Balanced NPK fertilizers
2. pH adjustment products

description: Maintaining blueberry bush health
prevention_tips:
1. Maintain soil pH 4.5-5.2
2. Annual pruning of old canes
3. 2-4" pine needle mulch
4. Consistent moisture (drip irrigation ideal)
treatment_methods:
1. Soil testing every 2 years
2. Bird netting when fruiting
3. Regular weed control
organic_options:
1. Coffee grounds for pH maintenance
2. Fish emulsion fertilizer
3. Compost tea drenches
chemical_options:
1. Ammonium sulfate for nitrogen
2. Chelated iron if chlorosis appears

description: White powdery fungal growth on leaves and shoots
prevention_tips:
1. Plant resistant varieties
2. Avoid overhead watering
3. Prune for good air circulation
4. Remove infected plant material
treatment_methods:
1. Apply fungicides at first sign
2. Remove severely infected shoots
3. Time applications to protect new growth
organic_options:
1. Milk spray (1:9 ratio)
2. Baking soda solution
3. Neem oil

description: Maintaining cherry tree health
prevention_tips:
1. Well-drained soil with pH 6.0-7.0
2. Annual pruning after fruiting
3. Balanced fertilizer in early spring
4. Bird protection for fruit
treatment_methods:
1. Dormant oil spray for pests
2. Regular inspection for borers
3. Summer pruning for airflow
organic_options:
1. Compost mulch
2. Companion planting with alliums
3. Beneficial nematodes
chemical_options:
1. Balanced fruit tree fertilizers
2. Calcium sprays to prevent cracking

description: Fungal disease causing rectangular tan lesions with dark borders on leaves
prevention_tips:
1. 3-year crop rotation
2. Resistant hybrids
3. Proper plant spacing
4. Remove crop debris after harvest
treatment_methods:
1. Fungicide applications at disease onset
2. Early planting to avoid peak disease periods
3. Foliar nutrient support
organic_options:
1. Copper-based fungicides
2. Bacillus subtilis
3. Compost tea sprays

description: Orange-brown pustules on leaves caused by Puccinia sorghi
prevention_tips:
1. Early planting
2. Resistant hybrids
3. Avoid overhead irrigation
4. Balanced nitrogen fertilization
treatment_methods:
1. Fungicide applications when first pustules appear
2. Foliar zinc applications
3. Remove volunteer corn plants
organic_options:
1. Sulfur dust
2. Neem oil
3. Potassium bicarbonate

description: Elliptical gray-green lesions that turn tan with age, caused by Exserohilum turcicum
prevention_tips:
1. Resistant hybrids
2. Crop rotation (2+ years non-host)
3. Deep plowing of crop debris
4. Proper plant spacing
treatment_methods:
1. Fungicide applications at disease onset
2. Early planting
3. Foliar nutrient support
organic_options:
1. Copper fungicides
2. Bacillus subtilis
3. Compost extracts

description: Maintaining healthy corn plants
prevention_tips:
1. Proper planting depth (1.5-2")
2. Soil testing and balanced fertilization
3. Adequate spacing (8-12" apart)
4. Crop rotation
treatment_methods:
1. Regular scouting for pests
2. Side-dressing nitrogen at knee-high stage
3. Irrigation during drought
organic_options:
1. Compost application
2. Cover cropping
3. Fish emulsion fertilizer
chemical_options:
1. Starter fertilizers
2. Foliar micronutrients
3. Herbicides for weed control

description: Fungal disease causing brown leaf spots and mummified berries (Guignardia bidwellii)
prevention_tips:
1. Remove all mummies during dormancy
2. Proper canopy management
3. Resistant varieties
4. Avoid overhead irrigation
treatment_methods:
1. Critical spray at 3-5" shoot growth
2. Pre-bloom spray (most important)
3. Post-bloom spray
4. Fruit thinning
organic_options:
1. Sulfur dust
2. Serenade MAX (Bacillus amyloliquefaciens)
3. Horsetail tea extract

description: Complex wood disease causing tiger-stripe leaf patterns and berry spotting
prevention_tips:
1. Avoid trunk wounds
2. Paint pruning cuts
3. Remove infected vines
4. Balanced nutrition
treatment_methods:
1. Trunk surgery to remove infected wood
2. Preventive fungicide sprays
3. Vineyard sanitation
organic_options:
1. Compost tea drenches
2. Trichoderma applications
3. Seaweed extracts
chemical_options:
1. Tebuconazole trunk sprays
2. Sodium tetrathiocarbonate
3. Cyprodinil + Fludioxonil

description: Fungal disease causing angular brown spots with yellow halos
prevention_tips:
1. Proper canopy management
2. Remove infected leaves
3. Avoid overhead irrigation
4. Balanced fertilization
treatment_methods:
1. Copper sprays at first symptoms
2. Fungicide rotations
3. Defoliation of severely infected leaves
organic_options:
1. Copper octanoate
2. Bacillus subtilis
3. Potassium bicarbonate

description: Maintaining grapevine health
prevention_tips:
1. Proper trellising system
2. Balanced pruning (30-50 buds per vine)
3. Soil pH 5.5-6.5
4. Regular irrigation schedule
treatment_methods:
1. Dormant pruning
2. Shoot positioning
3. Leaf removal in fruit zone
organic_options:
1. Compost applications
2. Cover crops
3. Compost tea sprays
chemical_options:
1. Balanced fertilizers
2. pH adjustment products
3. Foliar nutrients

description: Bacterial disease causing yellow shoots, lopsided fruit, and bitter juice (Candidatus Liberibacter asiaticus)
prevention_tips:
1. Source certified disease-free trees
2. Psyllid monitoring with yellow sticky traps
3. Screen houses for young trees
4. Remove infected trees immediately
treatment_methods:
1. Soil-applied systemic insecticides
2. Foliar psyllid control during flushes
3. Nutritional programs to prolong productivity
organic_options:
1. Kaolin clay sprays
2. Tamarixia radiata releases
3. Compost tea drenches

description: Bacterial disease causing angular leaf spots and fruit cracking (Xanthomonas arboricola)
prevention_tips:
1. Resistant varieties (e.g., 'Redhaven')
2. Copper sprays at leaf fall and bud swell
3. Avoid pruning during wet weather
4. Balanced soil pH (6.0-6.5)
treatment_methods:
1. Streptomycin at petal fall (where permitted)
2. Oxytetracycline during shuck split
3. Remove severely infected twigs
organic_options:
1. Copper octanoate (Cueva)
2. Regalia (giant knotweed extract)
3. Compost tea foliar sprays
chemical_options:
1. Kasugamycin (where registered)
2. Mancozeb + copper combos
3. Acibenzolar-S-methyl (Actigard)

description: Maintaining peach tree health
prevention_tips:

chemical_options:

2. Remove and destroy infected plants

description: Viral disease causing mottled leaves and stunted growth
prevention_tips:
1. Resistant varieties
2. Disinfect tools
3. Control chewing insects
4. Avoid smoking near plants
treatment_methods:
1. No cure - remove infected plants
2. Rogue symptomatic plants
3. Control insect vectors
organic_options:
1. Milk spray (may reduce transmission)
2. Beneficial insects for pest control
chemical_options:
1. Insecticides for vector control
2. Virucides are generally ineffective
